when studying the past metas of a game
the thing you'll end up asking yourself
the most is what were the devs thinking
sometimes this can be because they nerf
your favorite builds sometimes it's
because they added a newer more
overpowered class of the game and
sometimes the changes they make to the
overall make you question whether the
devs even bother to play test the update
before it went live and that is what
players were wondering when the devs
rolled out patch one point one point
five the Carboniferous update this
update was a serious game changer for
literally every player because of the
two main changes this update introduced
the first is that it introduced
abilities that allowed vertebrates to
join terrestrial servers up until this
point arthropods had total control of
the land but all of this changed once
the devs gave vertebrates access to the
amniotes kill tree the most important
thing this led them unlock was the
eggshell ability which allowed them to
move their spawn points on to land it
was looking like the meta was going to
be rapidly evolving becoming more
balanced and diverse so as you can
imagine it was a pretty hype time for
the community however this hype was
quickly overshadowed by the glaring lack
of balance across all of the terrestrial
servers due to the second change the
devs made what they did was bump up the
spawn rates of plants why they did this
no one knows but it's my personal theory
that the devs were just worried that
there wouldn't be enough loot for all of
the emerging forests real factions
anyways this was obviously a massive
oversight on their part some players
thought it was a glitch some assumed it
was just incompetence but the end result
was the same
increasing the plant spawn rate also
increases the oxygen level of the
overworld and guess which builds have
the stats that scaled the best with
atmospheric oxygen arthropods of course
and so even though the devs were trying
to shift the balance of power away from
the arthropods by buffing a new
competition what ended up happening was
that arthropods became far more powerful
than the new terrestrial vertebrates
could ever challenge let me show you
what I'm talking about
so the HP stat of an arthropod scales
directly with the atmospheric oxygen
level this is why in the meta of present
day all terrestrial arthropods are stuck
in the lower weight classes with an
oxygen level of only around 20% they're
better off sinking their evolution
points into other stats and abilities
during the Carboniferous meta the oxygen
level was around 35% meaning that with
only a few points spent on HP arthropods
could have a ridiculous amount of HP and
still have plenty of points to put into
other skills like venom armor
and even the coveted flight ability
let's take a look at some of the more
notorious examples of over sanded
arthropods all of these are STR pretty
much just by default since the only
competition they had was from other
arthropods let's start with arthropleura
this is a defense tank build with armor
that could put a modern-day turtle or
armadillo player to shame the armor
could defend against the fangs of giant
spiders and the bite of ancient
amphibian jaws as impressive as this is
it's worth noting that this was even
more opie at the time due to a lack of
intelligence pills which are the main
counter to defense built of course
arthropleura was our herbivore which
meant it's only real weakness was for
the most part irrelevant the PvP builds
of this meta had no such issues while
there's no shortage of terrifying aerial
insect builds in present day none would
stand a chance against the eagle sized
speed demons known as Griffon flies they
had the same unmatched aerial mobility
that modern-day dragonfly Mane's do but
without the glaring lack of defense and
power because of this these players had
a completely unchallenged dominance over
the aerial domain and were a nightmare
for the struggling new reptile and
amphibian players that were trying to
break into the terrestrial matter yoke
by now I'm sure you're wondering how
long did the devs let such an imbalance
meta go on well relatively speaking not
that long
compared to how they let dinosaurs reign
for nearly 200 million years the 60
million year reign of the arthropods
wasn't that absurd still awful
considering that this was a glitch that
they should have saw coming but oh well
after 60 million years of one of the
least diverse meadows of all time the
devs dropped patch one point one point
six called the great rain forest
collapse and by extension made the giant
arthropods unviable this allowed other
terrestrial vertebrates to finally gain
a foothold in the meta and eventually
led to reptilian builds dominating
arthropods wouldn't become top-tier
again until insects unlock the eusocial

to fish in its name
